<hr>


<span style="font-size:.8em;"><strong>Abstract</strong>: DNA assembly is low throughput and unreliable. Implementing software platforms to automate DNA construct design is usually done by hand and consequently error-prone. Here, we present an open-source python package to integrate DNA assembly software outputs with the OT-2 liquid handling robot. Our package reduces the time, training, costs, and wastes associated with molecular biology. We demonstrate the versatility of our software by demonstrating several multipart assemblies.</span>

## Body row {data-height=72.5}

### **Introduction** {data-width=500}

#### <span style="font-size:.8em;">Motivation: To increase pheasability of synthetic biology by automating cloning workflows.</span>

<figure>

<img src="resources/goodo.png" style="width:90%">

<figcaption align = "center"><b><span style="font-size:.7em;">Fig. 1: The Cloning Workflow - (A) Design constructs with existing software algorithms. (B) Amplify parts (C) assemble new constructs. (D) Maintain constructs in *E. coli*, and (E) use for downstream applications and new constructs.</span></b></figcaption>

</figure>

#### <span style="font-size:.8em;">Workflow Pitfalls:</span>

<span style="font-size:.8em;">
<ol>
  <li>Extensive training and high error-rates are typical due to the complexity of this workflow in practice.</li>
  <li>Researchers focus more time and energy on executing the workflow instead of actually engineering biolgy.</li>
</ol>
</span>

### **Data and Methods** {data-width=300}

#### <span style="font-size:.8em;">Software Design:</span>

- Panels of scientists convened to review grant applications
- Reviewers serve 4-year terms, attending three meetings a year

#### <span style="font-size:.8em;">Data Collection:</span>

- Study section meeting rosters
- Author-ity: disambiguated authors in biomedical literature
- Web of Science: citations


## Footer row {data-height=6.5} 

### Conclusion {data-width=45}
<span style="font-size:.7em;">
  - DNtegrate flexibly performs DNA assemblies and could serve as an important tool in bringing synthetic biology to smaller labs without large workforces or extensive financial resources
</span>
